Key Match Events: The Boston Celtics earned a tremendous road win, defeating the Denver Nuggets 118-106.
The Celtics dominated in points in the paint, scoring 60 compared to the Nuggets' 46.
Kristaps Porziņģis played arguably his best game of the season, recording 25 points on 9-for-18 shooting from the field, 11 rebounds, two steals, and a block.
Porziņģis recorded 20 of his 25 points either in the restricted area or at the free throw line.
Pre-Game Insights: The absence of the Nuggets' superstar center Nikola Jokic influenced the Celtics' strategy.
Post-Match Reflections: Head coach Joe Mazzulla praised Kristaps Porziņģis for his performance, highlighting his physicality and intentionality in the paint.
Porziņģis has struggled with staying healthy this season but has been great while on the court, averaging 18.3 points per game, 6.8 rebounds, 1.7 assists, and 1.4 blocks.
